content: holiday gift bag designed by jennifer tideberg materials yarn- 2 5 ounces of worsted weight cotton such as peaches & creme needles- one set of size 4 us dpn size 4 us 16 circular gauge- not essential for this project but a tighter gauge will yield a sturdier bag with dpns cast on 9 stitches divide stitches evenly on 3 dpns join to work in the round starting at base of bag… round 1 place a stitch marker and then knit k the round round 2 knit into the front and back kfb of each stitch 18 stitches rounds 3 and 4 knit round 5 k 2 kfb repeating for the entire round 24 stitches round 6 knit round 7 k1 kfb repeating for the entire round 36 stitches rounds 8 and 9 knit round 10 k1 kfb repeating for the entire round 54 stitches round 11-12 knit round 13 k1 kfb repeating for the entire round 81 stitches an extra dpn is helpful at this point dividing stitches 20 20 20 21 round 14-15 knit round 16 purl round 17 knit round 18 purl round 19 knit round 20 purl round 21-22 knit you can switch to a 16 circular by round 22 this will speed up the knitting round 23 k2 decrease k 25 repeating for the entire round and ending with a final k 78 stitches round 23 this row prepares you for knitting the six-stitch pattern repeat other stitch patterns can be used simply calculate the number of stitches to either increase or decrease to evenly accommodate a multiple of your stitch pattern space these increases/decreases evenly around for this bag i needed to decrease 3 stitches to go from 81 stitches to 78 stitches a number evenly divided by 6 begin chart pattern holiday gift bag * note on row 5 you must remove the stitch marker slip the first stitch purlwise replace stitch marker and then begin the row making the yarn over yo this stitch is incorporated into the very last stitch sl 1 k2tog psso rounds 24- 47 work the chart 4 times shape the top round 48-50 knit round 59-62 knit round 51 purl round 63 purl round 52 change color if desired knit round 64 knit round 53 purl round 65 purl bind off secure ends and weave in round 54-57 knit round 58 eyelet row knit 3 k2tog yo skp around to last stitch k1 make the drawstring… the drawstring is an i-cord worked on 3 stitches with a dpn cast on 3 stitches knit these stitches slide stitches to other end of needle pull yarn across back and knit across giving the cord a slight tug after each row will help to even out stitches repeat until cord measures 28 inches long cut yarn and thread through the 3 stitches securing the end insert drawstring through eyelet row - 2 -
